results.title: Hemodynamic effects of pindolol and atenolol at rest and during isometric exercise: a noninvasive study with healthy volunteers.
results.text_hl: Only @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ reduced cardiac output and increased @<m>DISEASE_Peripheral_Nervous_System_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010523 @@@peripheral resistance@@@.

citations.NLM: Rapola JM, Pellinen TJ, Koskinen P, Toivonen L, Nieminen MS. Hemodynamic effects of pindolol and atenolol at rest and during isometric exercise: a noninvasive study with healthy volunteers. Cardiovasc Drugs Ther. 1990 Jun;4(3):737-43. PMID: 2076384
citations.BibTeX: @article{2076384, title={Hemodynamic effects of pindolol and atenolol at rest and during isometric exercise: a noninvasive study with healthy volunteers.}, author={Rapola JM and Pellinen TJ and Koskinen P and Toivonen L and Nieminen MS}, journal={Cardiovasc Drugs Ther}, volume={4}, number={3}, pages={737-43}}

results.title: Changes in the haemodynamics of large arteries induced by single doses of nicardipine, enalapril, atenolol and urapidil.
results.text_hl: Only @CHEMICAL_Nicardipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009529 @@@nicardipine@@@ caused a significant reduction in vessel wall tension both in the carotid and brachial arteries, while brachial @<m>DISEASE_Peripheral_Nervous_System_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010523 @@@peripheral resistance@@@ was significantly reduced by all the drugs except @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@.

citations.NLM: Pancera P, Arosio E, Priante F, Ribul M, Zannoni M, Talamini G, Lechi A. Changes in the haemodynamics of large arteries induced by single doses of nicardipine, enalapril, atenolol and urapidil. Eur J Clin Pharmacol. 1992;43(1):7-10. PMID: 1505613
citations.BibTeX: @article{1505613, title={Changes in the haemodynamics of large arteries induced by single doses of nicardipine, enalapril, atenolol and urapidil.}, author={Pancera P and Arosio E and Priante F and Ribul M and Zannoni M and Talamini G and Lechi A}, journal={Eur J Clin Pharmacol}, volume={43}, number={1}, pages={7-10}}

results.title: Comparison between moexipril and atenolol in obese postmenopausal women with hypertension.
results.text_hl: Most frequent adverse events under monotherapy (@CHEMICAL_moexipril @CHEMICAL_MESH:C058302 @@@moexipril@@@/@<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@) were @DISEASE_Asthenia @DISEASE_MESH:D001247 @@@asthenia@@@ (5.3/13.0%), @DISEASE_Headache @DISEASE_MESH:D006261 @@@headache@@@ (13.2/21.7%), @DISEASE_Cough @DISEASE_MESH:D003371 @@@cough@@@ (7.9/6.5%), @DISEASE_Pharyngitis @DISEASE_MESH:D010612 @@@pharyngitis@@@ (21.1/8.7%) and @<m>DISEASE_Peripheral_Nervous_System_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010523 @@@peripheral oedema@@@ (5.3/13.0%).

citations.NLM: Stimpel M, Koch B, Weber MA. Comparison between moexipril and atenolol in obese postmenopausal women with hypertension. Maturitas. 1998 Sep 20;30(1):69-77. PMID: 9819786
citations.BibTeX: @article{9819786, title={Comparison between moexipril and atenolol in obese postmenopausal women with hypertension.}, author={Stimpel M and Koch B and Weber MA}, journal={Maturitas}, volume={30}, number={1}, pages={69-77}}

results.title: Enalapril and Atenolol in Primary Hypertension-A Comparative Study of Blood Pressure Lowering and Hormonal Effects.
results.text_hl: There was one drop-out in each group, one due to @DISEASE_Erectile_Dysfunction @DISEASE_MESH:D007172 @@@impotence@@@ on the combination of @CHEMICAL_Enalapril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004656 @@@enalapril@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Hydrochlorothiazide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006852 @@@HCTZ@@@ and one due to @<m>DISEASE_Peripheral_Nervous_System_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010523 @@@peripheral coldness@@@ during @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ treatment.

citations.NLM: Öhman KP, Karlberg BE. Enalapril and Atenolol in Primary Hypertension-A Comparative Study of Blood Pressure Lowering and Hormonal Effects. Scand J Urol Nephrol. 1984 Jul;18(sup79):93-97. PMID: 27786012
citations.BibTeX: @article{27786012, title={Enalapril and Atenolol in Primary Hypertension-A Comparative Study of Blood Pressure Lowering and Hormonal Effects.}, author={Öhman KP and Karlberg BE}, journal={Scand J Urol Nephrol}, volume={18}, number={sup79}, pages={93-97}}

results.title: Enalapril and atenolol in primary hypertension--a comparative study of blood pressure lowering and hormonal effects.
results.text_hl: There was one drop-out in each group, one due to @DISEASE_Erectile_Dysfunction @DISEASE_MESH:D007172 @@@impotence@@@ on the combination of @CHEMICAL_Enalapril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004656 @@@enalapril@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Hydrochlorothiazide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006852 @@@HCTZ@@@ and one due to @<m>DISEASE_Peripheral_Nervous_System_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010523 @@@peripheral coldness@@@ during @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ treatment.

citations.NLM: Ohman KP, Karlberg BE. Enalapril and atenolol in primary hypertension--a comparative study of blood pressure lowering and hormonal effects. Scand J Urol Nephrol Suppl. 1984;79():93-7. PMID: 6089325
citations.BibTeX: @article{6089325, title={Enalapril and atenolol in primary hypertension--a comparative study of blood pressure lowering and hormonal effects.}, author={Ohman KP and Karlberg BE}, journal={Scand J Urol Nephrol Suppl}, volume={79}, pages={93-7}}

results.title: The importance of lipid solubility and receptor selectivity of beta-adrenoceptor blocking drugs for the occurrence of symptoms and side-effects in out-patients.
results.text_hl: The blockers most commonly used were @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (51.0%), @CHEMICAL_Timolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013999 @@@timolol@@@ (20.0%), @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ (18.5%) and @CHEMICAL_Metoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008790 @@@metoprolol@@@ (7.8%). beta-Blocker treatment was associated with a significantly increased frequency of @<m>DISEASE_Peripheral_Nervous_System_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010523 @@@central nervous system and peripheral symptoms@@@.

citations.NLM: Theodoresen L, Brørs O. The importance of lipid solubility and receptor selectivity of beta-adrenoceptor blocking drugs for the occurrence of symptoms and side-effects in out-patients. J Intern Med. 1989 Jul;226(1):17-23. PMID: 2569025
citations.BibTeX: @article{2569025, title={The importance of lipid solubility and receptor selectivity of beta-adrenoceptor blocking drugs for the occurrence of symptoms and side-effects in out-patients.}, author={Theodoresen L and Brørs O}, journal={J Intern Med}, volume={226}, number={1}, pages={17-23}}
